key_risks: Product safety issues, including failure to deliver medication and lack of alarms
Regulatory and compliance risks, including potential delays in FDA 510(k) clearance
Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on limited suppliers
Intense market competition in the MRI-compatible devices niche
controversies: Multiple MAUDE reports highlighting adverse events with infusion pumps
Class 2 recall of the MRidium 1057 MRI Syringe Adapter Set due to inlet occlusion risks
Insider stock sales, such as the CFO’s $135K sale, raising questions about management confidence
social_issues: Ethical concerns regarding device reliability and patient outcomes due to adverse events and recalls
governance_issues: Potential governance concerns related to insider stock sales and management’s confidence in the company’s prospects

sources.title: MAUDE Adverse Event Report: IRADIMED CORP. IRADIMED; PUMP, INFUSION
sources.snippet: The iradium pump was programmed with the medication, propofol, at a particular infusion rate, however, the anesthesiologist visibly noticed that the medication was not flowing at the programmed rate.The infusion medications were not being delivered, and the pumps did not alarm nor indicate any problem.Due to the lack of medication infusion, the patient moved at a critical point in the ...

sources.title: iRadimed clears 5-year-old warning letter - Drug Delivery Business
sources.snippet: iRadimed (NSDQ:IRMD) last week finally cleared a five-year-old warning letter from the FDA issued over quality issues with its IV infusion pumps.. sources.title: Pump Compliance — IRadimed
sources.snippet: IRadimed's non-magnetic design allows our flagship products to operate safely in ultra high magnetic fields, eliminating the need for long lines and other workarounds used with traditional infusion pumps. IRadimed is the only non-magnetic IV pump manufacturer with FDA clearance to operate in MRI Zone IV at the patient bedside.

sources.snippet: One of our iradimed mridium 3860+ pumps broke due to liquid that got into the pump drug library card slot.This card slot sticks out slightly from the back of the device and is exposed to the clinical environment.A metal bar covers the card preventing it from being removed easily, but does not isolate the card from any environmental factors.There was a spill and liquid easily entered the sim ...

queries.rationale: Investigate potential regulatory non-compliance or legal challenges with FDA
